name: Old Fashioned
ingredients: 2 oz Whiskey (Bourbon for sweet, Rye for spicy)
0.25 oz Demerara Syrup (or 1 sugar cube + 3 dashes water)
instructions: Add demerara syrup and bitters to mixing glass Add whiskey Fill mixing glass 3/4 full with ice Stir with bar spoon for 30-45 seconds (approx. 40 rotations) Strain into rocks glass over a fresh large ice cube Express orange peel: Hold 4 inches above drink, shiny side down, pinch sharply to spray oils Rub expressed peel around rim of glass and drop in

name: The New Fashioned
ingredients: 2 oz Non-Alcoholic Whiskey Alternative (e.g., Lyre’s American Malt)
instructions: Add syrup and non-alcoholic bitters to mixing glass Add the NA whiskey alternative Add ice and stir for 20 seconds (don't over-dilute) Strain over a large ice cube Express orange peel over the glass and insert

name: Apple on the Rocks
ingredients: 4 oz High-quality Apple Juice (cloudy/unfiltered looks best)
Large ice cube (or several regular ones)
instructions: Place large ice cube in glass Pour apple juice over the ice Add a tiny dash of grenadine if you want a "sunset" color Stir gently like a grown-up Garnish with an orange slice on the rim

name: Manhattan
ingredients: 2 oz Rye Whiskey (Rittenhouse or Bulleit Rye)
1 oz Sweet Vermouth (Carpano Antica or Dolin Rouge)
instructions: Chill your coupe glass (freezer for 5 mins or fill with ice water) Add rye, sweet vermouth, and bitters to mixing glass Fill mixing glass 3/4 full with ice Stir smoothly for 30-45 seconds Strain into the chilled coupe Garnish with a high-quality cherry (Luxardo or Amarena)

name: Manhattan Midnight
ingredients: 2 oz Non-Alcoholic Rye Alternative (e.g., Spiritless Kentucky 74)
1 oz Non-Alcoholic Sweet Vermouth Alternative (e.g., Lyre’s Aperitif Rosso)
instructions: Chill coupe glass Combine NA rye, NA vermouth, and bitters in mixing glass Add ice and stir for 20 seconds Strain into chilled glass Drop in cherry

name: Big City Cherry
ingredients: 3 oz Cherry Cola or Dr. Pepper (use Cherry Juice for caffeine-free)
instructions: Chill the glass (kids love a frosted glass) Pour the cold soda into the glass (no ice, just like the adult version!) Add a dash of grenadine for extra cherry flavor Drop in a cherry Serve immediately while fizzy

name: Negroni
ingredients: 1 oz Gin (London Dry - Tanqueray or Beefeater)
1 oz Sweet Vermouth (Carpano Antica or Cocchi di Torino)
instructions: Add gin, Campari, and sweet vermouth to mixing glass Fill mixing glass 3/4 full with ice Stir for 30 seconds (don't under-dilute; Campari needs water to open up) Strain into rocks glass over a fresh large ice cube Express orange peel heavily over the drink Run peel around rim and insert

name: Nogroni
ingredients: 1 oz Non-Alcoholic Gin (e.g., Monday Gin or Ritual)
1 oz Non-Alcoholic Bitter Apertif (e.g., Lyre’s Italian Orange or Giffard Bitter)
instructions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass with ice Stir for 20 seconds Strain over fresh ice Express orange peel

name: Red Sunset
ingredients: Splash of Club Soda or Sprite
instructions: Fill glass with ice Pour cranberry juice Pour orange juice Top with a splash of soda for fizz Stir gently Garnish with orange slice

name: Martini
ingredients: Lemon Twist or Olive for garnish
instructions: FREEZE THE GLASS: This is non-negotiable. The glass must be icy cold. Add gin, dry vermouth, and bitters to mixing glass Fill mixing glass to the top with ice Stir smoothly for 45-60 seconds (needs significant dilution and chilling) Strain into the frozen glass Garnish: Twist: Express lemon peel, run around rim, drop in. Olive: Rinse brine off olive, drop in (usually 1 or 3, never 2).

name: Garden Martini
ingredients: 0.5 oz Non-Alcoholic Dry Vermouth (e.g., Lyre’s Aperitif Dry)
instructions: Chill glass thoroughly Combine NA gin and NA vermouth in mixing glass with ice Stir well to chill (NA spirits don't freeze, so get it as cold as possible) Strain into frozen glass Garnish with lemon twist

name: The Spy Drink
ingredients: 3 oz White Grape Juice or Lemonade
1 Green Grape (to look like an olive)
instructions: Chill the glass Pour grape juice/lemonade Top with soda for sparkle Drop a green grape in the bottom (looks exactly like an olive!) Serve immediately

name: Sazerac
ingredients: 2 oz Rye Whiskey (Sazerac Rye or Rittenhouse)
instructions: Prepare Glass: Fill rocks glass with crushed ice and water to chill, set aside In a separate mixing glass, add syrup and Peychaud's bitters Add Rye whiskey and ice to mixing glass Stir for 30-40 seconds Rinse: Dump the ice water out of the rocks glass. Pour a splash of Absinthe in, swirl to coat the entire inside, and discard excess Strain the whiskey mixture into the absinthe-coated glass (NEAT - no ice) Express lemon peel over drink, then discard the peel (traditional) or hang on rim

name: N'awlins Fizz
ingredients: Drop of Anise Extract (to mimic Absinthe) OR Fennel Tea rinse
instructions: Chill glass Rinse glass with a drop of anise extract swirled in water, then dump Stir NA rye, syrup, and bitters with ice Strain into the rinsed glass Express lemon peel

name: Root Beer Sazerac
ingredients: 4 oz High-Quality Root Beer (like Virgil's or IBC)
instructions: Chill the glass (fill with ice water then dump) Pour the Root Beer (chilled) into the glass WITHOUT ice Twist a piece of lemon peel over the top Serve immediately

name: Vieux Carré
ingredients: Lemon Twist or Cherry for garnish
instructions: Add rye, cognac, sweet vermouth, Bénédictine, and both bitters to mixing glass Fill mixing glass 3/4 full with ice Stir for 30-45 seconds Strain into rocks glass over a fresh large ice cube Express lemon twist over drink and drop in

name: Quarter Square
ingredients: 1 oz Non-Alcoholic Brandy Alternative OR Apple Juice reduced by half
1 tsp Honey Syrup (mixed with a pinch of clove/nutmeg to mimic Bénédictine)
instructions: Combine all ingredients in mixing glass Stir with ice for 30 seconds Strain over large ice cube Garnish with lemon twist

name: Fancy Fruit Punch
instructions: Fill glass with ice Pour grape juice and apple juice (the mix mimics the Rye/Cognac color) Add dash of grenadine Top with splash of soda Stir Garnish with lemon twist

name: Whiskey Sour
ingredients: 2 oz Whiskey (Bourbon for sweet, Rye for spicy)
1 Egg White (optional but recommended for texture)
Cherry and/or Orange Slice for garnish
instructions: Add whiskey, lemon juice, simple syrup, and egg white to cocktail shaker (NO ice yet) DRY SHAKE: Shake vigorously WITHOUT ice for 15 seconds (this emulsifies the egg white and creates foam) WET SHAKE: Add ice to shaker, shake HARD for 10-12 seconds until shaker is frosty Strain into chilled coupe (up) or rocks glass (over ice) Garnish with cherry and orange flag

name: Whisk-Free Sour
ingredients: 2 oz Non-Alcoholic Whiskey Alternative (e.g., Spiritless Kentucky 74)
1 oz Aquafaba (chickpea water) or Egg White
instructions: Combine all ingredients in shaker Dry shake (no ice) for 15 seconds Add ice and wet shake for 10 seconds Strain into coupe Garnish with cherry

name: Lemon Cloud
ingredients: 1 oz Aquafaba (liquid from can of chickpeas - tasteless foam!)
instructions: Pour juices and aquafaba into a jar or shaker Let the kid shake it! (Great activity) Shake until very foamy Pour over fresh ice Top with a cherry

name: Margarita
instructions: Rim half the glass with salt (rub lime on rim, dip in salt) Add tequila, lime juice, and agave to shaker Fill shaker with ice Shake well for 10-12 seconds Strain into glass over fresh ice Garnish with lime wedge

name: Margarita Zero
ingredients: 2 oz Non-Alcoholic Tequila Alternative (e.g., Ritual Tequila Alternative)
instructions: Rim glass with salt Shake NA tequila, lime, and agave with ice Strain over fresh ice Garnish with lime

name: Limeade Slush
instructions: Rim glass with sugar Fill glass with crushed ice (or blend for a slushie) Pour limeade and Sprite Garnish with lime

name: Daiquiri
ingredients: 2 oz White Rum (Bacardi Superior or Havana Club)
instructions: Chill coupe glass Add rum, lime juice, and syrup to shaker Fill with ice Shake vigorously for 10-12 seconds Strain into chilled coupe Float lime wheel on top

name: No-Rum Daiquiri
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice Strain into chilled coupe Garnish

name: Pirate Juice
instructions: Fill glass with ice Pour pineapple and lime juice Top with Sprite Garnish with cherry

name: Cosmopolitan
ingredients: 0.5 oz Cranberry Juice (100% juice, not cocktail)
instructions: Chill martini glass Add ingredients to shaker Shake with ice for 10-12 seconds Strain into glass (should be pink, not red) Express orange peel over drink

name: Cosnopolitan
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice Strain into chilled glass Garnish

name: Pink Princess/Prince
instructions: Pour cranberry juice into glass with ice Top with Sprite Squeeze lime wedge and drop in

name: Gimlet
instructions: Chill coupe Shake gin, lime, and syrup with ice Strain into coupe Garnish with lime wheel

name: Garden Gimlet
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice Strain into coupe Garnish with cucumber

name: Lime Drop
instructions: Pour limeade over ice Top with soda Hang gummy worm on rim

name: Bee's Knees
ingredients: 0.75 oz Honey Syrup (3 parts honey to 1 part warm water)
instructions: Make Honey Syrup: Mix honey with a little warm water so it pours easily Add gin, lemon, and honey syrup to shaker Shake with ice Strain into chilled coupe Garnish with twist

name: Bee's Free
instructions: Shake tea, lemon, and honey with ice Strain into coupe Garnish with lemon

name: Honey Bear
instructions: Stir honey into lemonade Serve over ice

name: Sidecar
instructions: Sugar the rim of the coupe Add Cognac, lemon, and Triple Sec to shaker Shake with ice Strain into sugared glass

name: Side-Kick
instructions: Rim glass with sugar Shake ingredients with ice Strain into glass

name: Sugared Orange
instructions: Dip rim in sugar (kids love this part) Pour juices and sprite Serve with ice

name: Paper Plane
instructions: Add all 4 ingredients to shaker Shake with ice Strain into coupe Garnish with a tiny paper plane (optional)

name: Paper Glider
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice Strain into coupe

name: Orange Flyer
instructions: Pour juices over ice Rest a small paper plane on the rim (don't let it get wet!)

name: Lemon Drop
instructions: Rim glass with sugar Shake vodka, lemon, and syrup with ice Strain into sugared glass Garnish with twist

name: Lemon Pop
instructions: Rim glass Shake lemonade and vanilla with ice Strain

name: Sour Candy Cup
instructions: Sugar rim Pour lemonade Serve

name: Aviation
ingredients: 2 oz Gin (London Dry - Beefeater or Tanqueray)
0.25 oz Crème de Violette (Essential for the color)
instructions: Chill coupe glass Add gin, maraschino, crème de violette, and lemon juice to shaker Fill with ice Shake hard for 10-12 seconds Strain into chilled coupe (color should be pale blue/purple) Drop cherry in the bottom

name: Sky High
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice Strain into coupe Garnish with cherry

name: Purple Plane
ingredients: 1 drop Blue food coloring + 1 drop Red (Purple!)
instructions: Mix lemonade with food coloring to get light purple Pour over ice Garnish with cherry

name: Clover Club
ingredients: 0.5 oz Raspberry Syrup (or muddled fresh raspberries + simple syrup)
instructions: Add gin, lemon, raspberry syrup, and egg white to shaker DRY SHAKE: Shake without ice for 15 seconds WET SHAKE: Add ice, shake hard for 10 seconds Strain into chilled coupe Skewer 3 raspberries for garnish

name: Clover Leaf
instructions: Dry shake all ingredients Wet shake with ice Strain

name: Berry Foam
instructions: Shake juice and aquafaba until foamy Pour over ice Eat the raspberries

name: Hemingway Daiquiri
ingredients: 0.5 oz Fresh Grapefruit Juice (Ruby Red preferred)
instructions: Chill coupe Combine all ingredients in shaker Shake with ice Strain into coupe Garnish with lime

name: Writer's Block
instructions: Shake with ice Strain Garnish

name: Pink Grapefruitade
instructions: Mix over ice Squeeze lime

name: Amaretto Sour
ingredients: 0.75 oz Cask Strength Bourbon (Booker's or Knob Creek)
instructions: Add Amaretto, Bourbon, Lemon, Syrup, and Egg White to shaker DRY SHAKE: Shake without ice for 15 seconds WET SHAKE: Add ice, shake hard for 10 seconds Strain over fresh ice Garnish

name: Almond Sour
ingredients: 2 oz Strong Black Tea (replaces bourbon body)
instructions: Dry shake all ingredients Wet shake with ice Strain over fresh ice

name: Nutty Lemonade
instructions: Stir lemonade and orgeat Serve over ice

name: Tom Collins
ingredients: 2 oz Gin (Old Tom Gin is traditional, London Dry is fine)
instructions: Add gin, lemon, and syrup to shaker Shake briefly with ice (just to chill/mix) Strain into tall glass filled with fresh ice Top with club soda Stir gently to incorporate Garnish

name: Tim Collins
instructions: Build in glass over ice Stir gently Garnish

name: Sparkling Lemonade
instructions: Mix lemon and syrup in glass Add ice Top with soda Stir

name: Pisco Sour
ingredients: 3 drops Angostura Bitters (garnish on top of foam only)
instructions: Add Pisco, lime, syrup, and egg white to shaker DRY SHAKE: Shake without ice for 15 seconds WET SHAKE: Add ice, shake hard for 10 seconds Strain into glass The Art: Carefully drop 3 drops of bitters onto the white foam. Use a toothpick to drag them into heart shapes.

name: Inca Sour
instructions: Dry shake all ingredients Wet shake with ice Strain and garnish with bitters drops

name: Grape Foam
instructions: Shake vigorously until foamy Pour into cup

name: Moscow Mule
ingredients: 4-5 oz Ginger Beer (spicy, NOT Ginger Ale)
instructions: Fill copper mug with ice Add vodka and lime juice Top with Ginger Beer Stir briefly Garnish with lime

name: Garden Mule
instructions: Muddle cucumber slightly in mug Add ice, lime, and ginger beer Stir

name: Spicy Soda
instructions: Pour over ice Stir

name: Mojito
ingredients: 0.5 oz Simple Syrup (or 2 tsp superfine sugar)
instructions: Put mint and syrup/sugar in bottom of glass Muddle GENTLY: Just press to release oils. Do not shred the mint! Add lime juice and rum Fill glass 3/4 with crushed ice Stir rapidly to chill and lift mint leaves off bottom Top with soda and more ice Slap a mint sprig (to release aroma) and garnish

name: Nojito
instructions: Muddle mint, lime, syrup Add ice and soda Stir

name: Minty Sprite
instructions: Clap mint leaves in hand (makes them smell good) Drop in glass with ice Pour Sprite Squeeze lime

name: Paloma
ingredients: Top with Grapefruit Soda (Squirt, Jarritos Toronja, or Fever-Tree Grapefruit)
instructions: Rim glass with salt (optional but recommended) Fill glass with ice Add tequila, lime, and salt pinch Top with grapefruit soda Stir gently

name: Dove Tale
instructions: Build over ice Stir

name: Pink Fizz
instructions: Sugar rim Pour soda over ice

name: Aperol Spritz
instructions: Fill wine glass with ice Pour Prosecco Pour Aperol Top with Soda Stir once Garnish with orange slice

name: Bitter Orange Spritz
ingredients: 3 oz NA Sparkling Wine or Tonic Water
instructions: Build over ice Stir

name: Orange Sparkle
instructions: Pour juice over ice Top with soda Garnish

name: Pomegranate Hugo Spritz
instructions: Fill wine glass with ice Add St-Germain and Pomegranate Juice Pour Prosecco Top with Soda Stir gently Garnish with mint and seeds

name: Pom-Flower Fizz
instructions: Build over ice Stir Garnish

name: Ruby Sparkler
instructions: Pour juice over ice Top with Sprite Drop in seeds

name: Ranch Water
ingredients: Top with Topo Chico (Must be Topo Chico mineral water)
instructions: Fill glass with ice Add tequila and lime Top with Topo Chico Stir gently

name: Ranch Soda
instructions: Ice, Lime, Topo Chico Stir

name: Lime Bubble
instructions: Pour over ice Stir

name: Dark 'n' Stormy
instructions: Fill glass with ice Pour Ginger Beer and Lime Juice FIRST Float the Dark Rum on top (creates the "Storm cloud" effect) Garnish with lime Stir before drinking

name: Safe Harbor
ingredients: 1 oz Molasses Syrup (dilute molasses with water) - floated on top
instructions: Pour ginger beer and lime over ice Float the molasses syrup

name: Storm Cloud
instructions: Pour Ginger Ale over ice Gently pour Cola on top to create a dark layer

name: Mint Julep
instructions: Muddle mint and syrup gently in bottom of cup Fill cup halfway with crushed ice Pour bourbon Stir until cup gets frosty Mound more crushed ice on top like a snow cone Garnish with a massive bouquet of mint (slapped)

name: Maple Mint Julep
instructions: Muddle mint and maple Add tea and crushed ice Stir until frosty

name: Mint Snow Cone
instructions: Fill cup with crushed ice Pour apple juice over it Stick mint in top

name: French 75
instructions: Shake gin, lemon, and syrup with ice Strain into flute Top with Champagne Garnish with lemon twist

name: French 0
instructions: Shake base Top with NA bubbles

name: Fancy Toast
ingredients: Sparkling Cider or White Grape Juice
instructions: Pour cider into flute Drop raspberry in bottom

name: Gin Fizz
instructions: Combine gin, lemon, syrup, and egg white in shaker Dry Shake vigoroulsy (15s) Wet Shake with ice (15s) Strain into tall glass (no ice) Slowly top with soda water to lift the foam head

name: Faux Fizz
instructions: Same shake procedure as alcoholic version Top with soda

name: Vanilla Cloud
instructions: Stir syrup and cream Top with soda (Italian Soda style)

name: Vesper
instructions: Combine spirits and Lillet Shake well with ice (Bond ordered it shaken) or Stir (better for texture) Strain into chilled glass Express large lemon peel

name: The Spy Zero
ingredients: 0.5 oz White Grape Juice + drop of vinegar (mimics Lillet)
instructions: Shake and strain

name: Lemon Water
instructions: It's just fancy water.

name: Tequila Sunrise
instructions: Fill glass with ice Add tequila and OJ The Trick: Tilt glass and pour grenadine slowly down the side. It will sink to the bottom. Do not stir (serve with gradient visible)

name: Sweet Sunrise
instructions: Pour juice and sprite over ice Sink the grenadine

name: Mai Tai
ingredients: 2 oz Aged Rum (Jamaican preferred - Appleton or Smith & Cross)
Garnish: Mint Sprig + Spent Lime Shell (looks like an island and palm tree)
instructions: Combine all ingredients in shaker Shake with ice Strain into glass filled with crushed ice Garnish with mint sprig and the upside-down lime shell

name: Mai No-Tai
ingredients: 2 oz Strong Black Tea (mimics aged rum)
instructions: Shake with ice Strain over crushed ice Garnish heavily

name: Island Punch
instructions: Pour over ice Umbrella garnish (Essential!)

name: Piña Colada
ingredients: 1.5 oz Cream of Coconut (Coco Lopez - NOT coconut milk)
instructions: Blended: Add all ingredients + 1 cup ice to blender. Blend until smooth. Shaken: Add ingredients to shaker with cubes. Shake HARD. Strain over crushed ice. Garnish with Pineapple Wedge + Cherry

name: Virgin Colada
instructions: Blend with ice

name: Coco Snow
instructions: Blend Umbrella

name: Zombie
ingredients: 0.5 oz Donn’s Mix (2 parts grapefruit juice, 1 part cinnamon syrup)
instructions: Combine everything (except 151 rum) in shaker/blender cup Flash blend with 1 cup crushed ice for 5 seconds OR shake hard Pour contents into tall glass Top with more crushed ice Float the 151 Rum on top Garnish: Mint sprig (smack it!)

name: The Walker
instructions: Shake with ice Pour over crushed ice

name: Monster Punch
instructions: Pour juices over ice Pour grenadine over top Hang worms out of glass

name: Blue Hawaiian
ingredients: 0.5 oz Blue Curaçao (Orange liqueur dyed blue)
1 oz Sweet & Sour Mix (Make fresh: 1 part lime/lemon, 1 part sugar)
instructions: Combine ingredients in shaker Shake with ice Strain over crushed ice (or blend for frozen version) Garnish with pineapple and cherry

name: Blue Lagoon
ingredients: 0.5 oz Blue Curaçao Syrup (Monin makes a non-alcoholic one) OR Blue Gatorade/Powerade
instructions: Shake and pour over ice

name: Ocean Water
instructions: Dye the Sprite blue Add ice Drop fish in

name: Jungle Bird
ingredients: 1.5 oz Dark Rum (Blackstrap style adds richness)
instructions: Combine all ingredients in shaker Shake hard with ice (needs good dilution to tame the Campari) Strain into rocks glass over fresh ice Garnish with pineapple wedge

name: Jungle Dove
ingredients: 2 oz San Pellegrino Sanbitter (or Giffard NA Aperitif)
0.5 oz Molasses Syrup (for the dark rum notes)
instructions: Shake pineapple, lime, and syrup Strain over ice Top with Sanbitter

name: Pineapple Punch
instructions: Pour over ice Stir

name: Penicillin
ingredients: 2 oz Blended Scotch (Famous Grouse or Monkey Shoulder)
0.25 oz Peated Single Malt Scotch (Laphroaig 10 or Ardbeg) - FLOAT ON TOP
instructions: Combine blended scotch, lemon, and syrup in shaker Shake with ice Strain over fresh large ice cube The Float: Gently pour the peated scotch over the back of a spoon so it sits on top Garnish with candied ginger

name: Placebo
ingredients: 2 oz Smoked Tea (Lapsang Souchong) - strong brew
instructions: Shake tea, lemon, and syrup Strain over ice Top with splash of ginger beer

name: Ginger Honey Fizz
instructions: Mix over ice Stir

name: Espresso Martini
ingredients: 0.5 oz Coffee Liqueur (Kahlúa or Mr. Black)
0.25 oz Simple Syrup (Adjust based on sweetness of liqueur)
instructions: Brew espresso Add all ingredients to shaker with LOTS of ice Shake HARD: You need to aerate the coffee oils to get the foam Strain quickly into chilled glass Place 3 beans in a petal pattern on the foam

name: Espresso Marti-No
ingredients: 1 oz Heavy Cream or Coconut Milk
instructions: Shake espresso, cream, and syrup with ice Strain Garnish

name: Choco-Latte
instructions: Shake chocolate milk with ice to get it frothy Strain into glass Top with whipped cream and chips

name: White Russian
instructions: Fill glass with ice Add vodka and Kahlúa Stir to combine Float the cream on top gently Serve layered (drinker stirs it in)

name: White Ruskie
instructions: Pour coffee and syrup over ice Float cream

name: Cookies & Cream
instructions: Stir milk and syrup Top with crushed cookie

name: Smoked Old Fashioned
ingredients: 0.25 oz Maple Syrup (works better with smoke than sugar)
instructions: Build the drink in the glass (Whiskey, syrup, bitters, ice) Stir to chill Place glass in smoking cloche or use top-down smoker Fill with Cherry wood smoke Let sit for 10-15 seconds (don't over-smoke!) Reveal and garnish

name: Bonfire Zero
instructions: Smoke the apple juice. It absorbs smoke wonderfully.

name: Campfire Juice
instructions: Don't smoke the drink. Just garnish with a toasted marshmallow.

name: Smoked Manhattan
instructions: Smoke the EMPTY glass first (rinse method) Trap smoke in glass with a coaster Stir drink in mixing glass Release smoke from glass and pour drink in immediately

name: Oaxaca Old Fashioned
instructions: Combine ingredients in mixing glass Stir with ice Strain over large cube Flame the peel: Squeeze peel through a lighter flame over the drink

name: Smoked Boulevardier
instructions: Stir ingredients with ice Strain over fresh ice Smoke the final drink for 10 seconds

name: Smoked Penicillin
instructions: Make standard Penicillin Omit the float of peated scotch Instead, fill cloche with Pear wood smoke Serve

name: Corpse Reviver #2
instructions: Rinse inside of coupe with Absinthe Shake other ingredients with ice Strain into glass Garnish with lemon twist

name: Bramble
instructions: Build gin, lemon, syrup in glass Fill with crushed ice Pour Crème de Mûre over the top (creates bleeding effect) Garnish with blackberry

name: Last Word
instructions: Combine all 4 ingredients Shake with ice Strain Brandied Cherry garnish

name: Gold Rush
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice Strain over fresh ice Lemon twist
